title: Anja Shahu
text:
About Me
I am a Biostatistics PhD candidate at Columbia University, advised by Dr. Daniel Malinsky. My research revolves primarily around causal inference with applications related to environmental health and mental health. My current research project focuses on developing methods for conducting causal inference of rates of change in longitudinal settings that have complications, such as complex missingness and irregular assessment times.



Education
PhD in Biostatistics
Columbia University
Graduation: May 2027 (Expected)
MS in Biostatistics
Harvard University
Graduation: May 2022
BA in Public Health Studies
Johns Hopkins University
Graduation: May 2020
